items.title: 20,000 Leagues Under The Sea
items.subtitle: PG   December 1916   105min
items.description: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea is a 1916 silent film directed by Stuart Paton. The film's storyline is based on the novel Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea by Jules Verne. It also incorporates elements from Verne's The Mysterious Island.

items.title: Cinema Paradiso
items.description: A filmmaker recalls his childhood, when he fell in love with the movies at his village's theater and formed a deep friendship with the theater's projectionist.

items.title: Diane Birch: Speak a Little Louder
items.description: Throughout this new record, she lays bare the emotional rollercoaster of her life over the past couple of years; coping with heartbreak at the end of a long-lasting relationship, the pain of losing her father to cancer, and her dance with the light and dark of self on the road to womanhood.

items.title: Dolphin Diary
items.description: Jody McGrath and her family are sailing around the world researching dolphins, and Jody records all their exciting adventures in her Dolphin Diaries.

items.title: His Girl Friday
items.subtitle: PG   January 1940   92min
items.description: This was the second time the play had been adapted for the screen, the first occasion being the 1931 film also called The Front Page. The major change in this version, introduced by Hawks, is that the role of Hildy Johnson is a woman.

items.title: Sita Sings The Blues
items.subtitle: R   August 2009   82min
items.description: Sita Sings the Blues is a 2008 animated film written, directed, produced and animated by American artist Nina Paley.

items.title: Parable In The Lake
items.subtitle: R   May 2014   89min
items.description: So when you are in pain, the only thing you can do is to enlarge your sense of things...stop being a glass. Become a lake.

items.title: Buffoon Lives With Me
items.description: A buffoon is someone whose ridiculous behavior is a source of amusement to others.

items.title: 20,000 Leagues Under The Sea
items.subtitle: PG   December 1916   105min
items.description: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea is a 1916 silent film directed by Stuart Paton. The film's storyline is based on the novel Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea by Jules Verne. It also incorporates elements from Verne's The Mysterious Island.

items.title: The Gunmen
items.description: Little Joe and Hoss, mistaken for gunmen, get caught between feuding families.
items.subtitle: Season 1 - Episode 19

items.title: The Fear Merchants
items.subtitle: Season 1 - Episode 20
items.description: The Cartwrights come to the aid of a Chinese-American stable hand accused of murder.

items.title: The Spanish Grant
items.subtitle: Season 1 - Episode 21
items.description: A former dance hall girl poses as a Spanish heiress to claim a land grant that includes part of the Ponderosa.

items.title: Desert Justice
items.subtitle: Season 1 - Episode 22
items.description: A Ponderosa ranch hand faces charges of killing the wife of the U.S. marshal who came to arrest him.

items.title: Saloon Doors
items.subtitle: Season 2 - Episode 1
items.description: When a mysterious stranger enters town, the townsfolk fear something bad is about to happen.

items.title: Boot & Spurs
items.subtitle: Season 2 - Episode 2
items.description: Little Joe finds that big boots are hard to fill.

items.title: Two Shots of Whiskey
items.subtitle: Season 2 - Episode 3
items.description: A down-on-his-luck drifter arrives on the Ponderosa with the law close behind.

items.title: High Lonesome
items.subtitle: Season 2 - Episode 4
items.description: Hoss mourns the loss of his one true love, but learns a lesson about the power of forgivenss.
